history.content:
If you've completed the pre-reqs, submit the CS major application ASAP. You can coordinate acquiring all needed signature and submitting the double major packet after we've accepted you. 

Or attach a completed packet to your application and we'll be the first folks to sign it. We'll return it via email
If you've completed the pre-reqs, submit the CS major application ASAP. You can coordinate acquiring all needed signature and submitting the double major packets after we've accepted you.

Hi, so I kind of dropped the ball and thought that we apply for the double at the beginning of the semester after finishing prereqs/getting grades. I'm confident that I'll get the GPA requirement to declare CS, however I did not yet receive signature from my 1st major advisor for the double major application form and I am no longer in Berkeley to be able to speak with her. I am already enrolled in all of my classes for next semester and accordingly with my 4 year plan I am still able to graduate on time and in 4 years. Maybe it's not a big deal and it just sounds weird to me, but is it still fine for me to declare the double/apply for CS at the May 15th deadline as a junior 2nd semester student? Or would . I still be able to apply right now and have my advisor just sign it when the next semester starts? Thank you.
history.subject: Declaring double as junior spring?
